overview.short: Legionella bozemanae is a Gram-negative aerobic rod that can cause Legionella pneumonia, especially in immunocompromised hosts.
overview.clinical_context: Associated with sporadic cases and outbreaks linked to water sources; less common than L. pneumophila.

species_markers.notes: May be less consistently positive than L. pneumophila; interpret with other markers.
Urinary antigen tests primarily detect L. pneumophila serogroup 1 and are often negative for L. bozemanae.
Species-level confirmation is typically molecular due to biochemical overlap within Legionella.

common_confusions.reason: Shared BCYE requirement and morphology; many labs default to pneumophila without confirmatory methods.
Overlapping biochemical profile and non-fermentative metabolism.

when_to_question_identification: Positive urinary antigen strongly favors L. pneumophila serogroup 1 over L. bozemanae.
If gelatin and lipase are strongly positive, consider L. pneumophila more strongly.
Poor growth on BCYE suggests the isolate may not be Legionella.

recommended_next_tests.reason: Helps rapidly support L. pneumophila serogroup 1 when positive; negative does not exclude non-pneumophila species.
Best confirmation approach for non-pneumophila Legionella.
Useful if the database contains strong Legionella coverage and the organism is grown appropriately on BCYE.
